page.title: 13ST. MARGARET'S PARISH CHURCH
page.content: This church stands at the highest point in Lowestoft. The spire, which is 50ft. high, stands on a tower of 70ft.- it serves as a landmark for shipping entering Lowestoft harbour. The church is of dressed flint and limestone and stands to the north of the town. In 1983 the church celebrated its 500th. anniversary. The list of rectors dates back to 1308. On the north aisle wall are memorials to fishermen lost at sea and a plaque presented by HMS LOWESTOFT in 1965. The war memorial chapel commemorates 711 men killed in 1914- 1918 war. The rarest item in the church is the pre-reformation lectern. The font is medieval but the cover was added in 1940.
